DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Treatment Arm Randomization Proportion ISO21090.RTO.INT.NONNEG,INT.POS.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The relative proportion of study subjects to be randomized to the arm. EXAMPLE(S): If 1/3 of study subjects are to be randomized to Arm A and 2/3 to Arm B, then the values of randomizationWeight for Arms A and B, respectively, could be expressed as 1 and 2 or as 1/3 and 2/3.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A specific treatment protocol used in a clinical trial._The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.:A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A specific treatment protocol used in a clinical trial.

Concepts.definition: A specific treatment plan within a clinical trial that describes the activities a subject will be involved in as he or she progresses through the study.

Property.preferredDefinition: The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.:A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

Concepts.definition: The allocation of individuals to groups by chance, especially in order to control the variables in an experiment.
A part, fraction, share, or number considered in relation to the whole amount or number.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: DEC released per model owner approval.  mc 2/2/11

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Quantity quotient of a numerator of type INT.NONNEG divided by a denominator of type INT.POS.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.
